title: Mereka Bilang, Saya Monyet!
descriptions:
In the vibrant and bustling city of Jakarta, Indonesia, a young street boy named Andri finds himself torn between his dreams and his harsh reality. "Mereka Bilang, Saya Monyet!" (They Say I'm a Monkey!) is a 2008 Indonesian drama film that brilliantly explores the themes of poverty, ambition, and the struggle for identity.

Andri, a resourceful and intelligent young boy, sells monkeys to tourists as a means of survival. Despite his unfortunate circumstances, he dreams of a better life and aspires to attend a prestigious school in the city. As he goes about his daily routine of selling monkeys, he encounters various individuals who shape his perspective on life.

One such individual is a wealthy and kind-hearted woman named Mrs. Sulastri, who takes pity on Andri and offers him a chance to escape his impoverished life. She provides him with an opportunity to attend the prestigious school, under the condition that he must leave his old life behind. Although Andri is hesitant at first, he eventually accepts Mrs. Sulastri's offer in the hope of a brighter future.

However, as Andri begins his journey towards a better life, he faces numerous challenges that test his resolve and question his identity. He struggles to fit in with his privileged classmates, who ridicule him for his humble beginnings and call him a monkey. As Andri grapples with the harsh realities of the class divide, he begins to question the true meaning of success and happiness.

Meanwhile, Andri's old friends on the streets are also undergoing their own transformations. Some of them turn to a life of crime, while others find solace in their shared struggles. As Andri witnesses their plight, he is torn between his newfound opportunities and his loyalty to his old friends.

In the end, Andri must make a difficult decision that will determine his future. Will he choose to embrace his new life and leave his past behind, or will he return to his old life and fight for his friends? As Andri grapples with this complex dilemma, he learns valuable lessons about friendship, identity, and the true meaning of success.

"Mereka Bilang, Saya Monyet!" is a poignant and thought-provoking film that explores the complexities of poverty and ambition. Through the eyes of a young street boy, the film offers a unique perspective on the harsh realities of life in Jakarta and the struggles of those who are marginalized by society. With its powerful message and compelling narrative, this film is a must-watch for anyone who appreciates thoughtful and insightful cinema.
